data.title: From Ring to Silver Screen: 13 Wrestlers Who Became Movie Stars!
data.meta_description: From Ring to Silver Screen: 13 Wrestlers Who Became Movie Stars!
data.text:
One of his most famous acting roles was in the film The Princess Bride. His towering presence and unique physicality made him a perfect fit for the role.

Known by his ring name Stone Cold, Austin pursued opportunities in film and television, primarily in the action genre.

The wrestler successfully transitioned into a career as an actor. One of Batista's most prominent roles is Drax the Destroyer in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) films.

Known for his charismatic persona, Cena's acting career gained significant traction with his role in the movie The Marine

Hulk Hogan, whose real name is Terry Eugene Bollea, made appearances in various films and television shows, often capitalising on his larger-than-life persona.

Johnson's acting career took off with his breakthrough role as Mathayus, the Scorpion King, in The Mummy Returns (2001).

Kane, whose real name is Glenn Jacobs, appeared in the WWE-produced film See No Evil, where he played the character Jacob Goodnight, a deranged serial killer.

Michael Gregory Mizanin appeared in the WWE Studios film The Marine 3: Homefront, where he played a Marine who must rescue his kidnapped sister.

One of Nash's notable acting roles came in the 1998 film "The Longest Yard," where he played the character Guard Engleheart.

Roddy Piper, whose real name was Roderick George Toombs, showcased his talents in various film and television projects, leaving a notable mark as an actor.

El Santo starred in films typically featuring him as a heroic wrestler who would fight against various villains, including monsters, vampires, and evil masterminds.

Following his successful wrestling career, Ventura ventured into acting. He played a role in the 1987 film "Predator" and made appearances in many others.
